Content: [telegram] <Regnar> yea but still. the most common and logical reason it is showing a different address is a different seed. and it can be a single space off, or letter off, etc. so if you wrote it down, the best bet is to type it in a notepad so you can see the letters and spaces, verify its what you wrote down. then highlight the whole thing and make sure the highlighter isn't including a space at the end (even if you don't have a space, sometimes it'll add one when you highlight)

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Hermes08> its a way of seeing it I always recommend to use the one assigned by default by the wallet ...using a random set of words made by yourself is not as effective as a random seed suggested by the wallet...what happened to him can be caused because he wrote down his seed manually apparently he didn't copied it correctly so he can even have a double space between words or triple space if he was careless...in that moment or if he had an error

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Hermes08> This is very common for new users that don't know how to use and take care of their private keys...so we added a feature to let the user create a pin to save his address and access it through a password

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
